unit_learning_outcomes.description: Understand the fundamental difference between univariate and multivariate analysis.
Understand likelihood based, as well as minimum expected cost based, discriminant analysis. Be able to apply these discriminant analysis methods to real data.
Understand and be able to apply MANOVA and understand multivariate regression.
Know how to perform hypothesis testing (mainly the Hotelling T2 test and chi-square test) using multivariate data.
Know the theories of PCA and factor analysis (FA), and be able to apply these methods to real data.
Know how to display multivariate data graphically using R and be able to use the R package for multivariate data analysis.

assessments.description: Students should prepare this assignment using a word-processing software such as Microsoft Word or Latex and then students should convert the assignment to a pdf document.
Students should prepare this assignment using a word-processing software such as Microsoft Word or Latex and then students should convert the assignment to a pdf document.
Formal invigilated examination testing the learning outcomes of the unit.

Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
data.description: This unit studies basic methods of multivariate statistical analysis. Multivariate data arise when each unit of observation in the sample has more than one variable measured. Multivariate statistical analysis provides ways to analyse dependence structures within multivariate data, as well as to meaningfully simplify, classify and group such data. The unit introduces methodologies and techniques for the exploration and analysis of multivariate data. Topics include graphical displays, discriminant analysis, principal components analysis, multivariate normal distribution, multivariate linear models, cluster analysis.
data.title: Multivariate Analysis

title: Multivariate Analysis
